poem:
"Ode to New Beginnings"

In Punxsutawney, surprise unfolds,
Two baby hogs in earthy holds.
Whispers of weather in their dreams,
Under library lamps' gentle beams.
Phil and Phyllis, parents so proud,
Announcing the news, joyfully loud.
"We have babies!" resonates in the air,
A testament of love, beyond compare.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Punxsutawney Phil and partner Phyllis welcome two baby groundhogs The weather-predicting groundhog Punxsutawney Phil and his partner Phyllis have sprung a surprise nobody saw coming: welcoming two baby groundhogs into the world. In a post on Wednesday, the Punxsutawney Groundhog Club Inner Circle of Pennsylvania announced the news, saying: “We have babies!” “The babies are currently in with mom and dad at the zoo that is located at the Punxsutawney Memorial Library, and can be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
